result.execSummary:
The defendant Markese K. Tibbs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Markese K. Tibbs is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Markese K. Tibbs was found guilty of Felony Murder [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.03.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
*  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.  
*  Pay restitution plus surcharges.  
*  Hearing to be set before Comm Dowse.    
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
May not have contact with felons, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

902  Clerk HM.   District Attorney Robert Zapf appeared for the State.    DE appears in custody and with Atty Rose.  Victims appear.   Court hears argument re: preliminary issues brought by Atty Rose re: recoverable restitution.   Court proceeds with testimony.   Atty Rose requests witnesses be sequestered - granted.    Victim, RW,  sworn in and testified.   Court reviews stats re: sequestration - victims allowed back in the courtroom.     Victim, LW, sworn in and testified.   Victim, BE, sworn in and testified.    Court hears argument.   Court findings as stated on the record and orders restitution for funeral expenses in the amt of $16,060.71, $707.40 for medical bill, $4,356 for lost wages.   Restitution shall be joint and several.  Restitution remains open for purposes for continuing expenses - granted.  Atty Rose requests another hearing - 3/25 830am.   DE may appear by video for next hearing.

District Attorney Robert Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Terry Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Matt Knight appeared from the City Atty's office.  Atty Rose requests to delay sentencing until deft has time to review information; is no longer seeking release of the Police & Fire Commission's file; is seeking the release of the internal affairs report concerning Kyle Baars.  Court will issue a subpoena to have internal affairs report and the personel file of Kyle Baars produced to this court.  Atty Knight states he takes notice that documents were subpoenaed orally and make sure that those files are produced to the court.  HE continued to 3/24/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  DA Zapf appeared for the State.  Atty Terry Rose appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft not produced for today's hrg.  Atty Matt Knight appeared from the City Atty's office.  Atty Rose requests the Fire & Police Commission's file on Kyle Baars as well as the investigative report of Lt. Hetland.  Arguments heard.  Court finds there is no legal authority from this court to order the Police & Fire Commission to release their file.  With respect to the PD's file - there is no authority for the court to order public release of internal file especially while there is a ongoing criminal investigation.
